news.headline: ECB's Villeroy: We don't see a recession coming in France.
ECB's Villeroy: There probably will be more ECB rate cuts.
Balbec Capital raises $1.7B for Global Credit Strategy, largest fundraise cycle; total platform assets over $16B.
news.summary: In New York, alternative investment manager Balbec Capital, LP revealed the completion of the final closing of InSolve Global Credit Fund VI ("IGCF VI"). The fund, including related vehicles, raised more than $1.7 billion in equity commitments. This milestone marks the largest fundraising effort ever undertaken by Balbec, given the strong backing from existing clients and new global investor relationships. Balbec, with over $16 billion in platform assets, established a significant presence in the industry with this successful fundraise.

news.headline: Herc Holdings Inc. raises dividend by 5% to $0.70/share. Annual dividend now $2.80/share, up from $2.66/share.
news.summary: Herc Holdings, Inc., a top equipment rental supplier in North America, revealed that its Board of Directors has approved a hike in the quarterly dividend by $0.035 per share, marking a 5% increase to $0.70 per share. The dividend is set to be paid out on March 4, 2025, to shareholders on record as of February 18, 2025. This adjustment raises the annual indicated dividend to $2.80 per share from the previous rate of $2.66 per share. "We are pleased to announce this increase in dividend," said the company.

news.headline: ECB's Villeroy: We're nearing 2% inflation target.
Brainyites aim for mental health equity, ensuring all have access to care. Coach Waldman's philosophy key. Feb 4, 2025, CAPE CORAL, Fla.
news.summary: Brainyites advocate for the right of every individual, irrespective of age, gender, or race, to lead a content and mentally sound life. Coach Richard D. Waldman stresses a straightforward but impactful philosophy as the solution. This message was conveyed in CAPE CORAL, Fla., on February 4, 2025.

news.headline: Homethrive appoints Martin Graf, a healthcare industry leader, to its Board of Directors bringing 25 years of experience.
news.summary: Homethrive, a prominent caregiver support solutions provider based in Northbrook, Illinois, revealed on February 4, 2025, that Martin Graf has been appointed to its Board of Directors. With a robust background of more than 25 years in executive leadership and management consulting, Dr. Graf will bring valuable expertise to the company's strategic decision-making processes.

news.headline: Tequity Advisors appoints Felix Gelt as Senior VP. He brings SaaS M&A expertise. Leading firm in B2B SaaS transactions.
news.summary: Felix Gelt has recently become a part of Tequity, bringing extensive expertise in SaaS M&A Strategy, Financing, and Deal Execution. Tequity Advisors, known for their specialization in global Enterprise B2B SaaS, Cloud, and IT company sell-side transactions, made this announcement in Toronto on February 4, 2025.

news.headline: Nature's Generator launches new 30 & 50 Amp Automatic Transfer Switches for seamless power transitions.
news.summary: A new Automatic Transfer Switch (ATS) has been introduced by Nature's Generator, a prominent provider of renewable-energy home integration solutions based in Camarillo, California. This ATS facilitates secure and automatic shifts from utility to backup generator power. Released on February 4, 2025, the company unveiled two variations of the product: the 30 Amp and 50 Amp ATS models. This innovation aims to enhance the efficiency and reliability of power supply systems for residential applications.

news.headline: Hain Celestial doubling US network capacity with fourth distribution center, enhancing customer responsiveness, speed to shelf, and lowering costs.
news.summary: To improve customer service and efficiency, The Hain Celestial Group, Inc. (Nasdaq: HAIN) is implementing a distribution network expansion project as part of its Hain Reimagined strategy. This initiative in Hoboken, N.J. aims to boost customer responsiveness, speed up shelf placement, and cut transportation expenses. The project is set to enhance operations and drive growth for the company.

news.headline: NAPA appoints Lee Camp as Vice President of Business Development for West Region. Anesthesia organization.
news.summary: In Melville, New York on February 4, 2025, North American Partners in Anesthesia (NAPA), the top single-specialty anesthesia organization in the U.S., has appointed Lee Camp as the Vice President of Business Development for NAPA's West Region. Camp's new role will involve leading business development efforts in the western region for NAPA.

news.headline: C.A. Fortune's SRW welcomes Maggie Tinsley as new Executive Creative Director, bringing decades of experience.
news.summary: On February 4, 2025, in Chicago, SRW, a subsidiary of C.A. Fortune recognized for innovative marketing and communication tactics that redefine products like cottage cheese, proudly revealed Maggie Tinsley as their recently appointed Executive Creative Director. Tinsley brings with her years of expertise in the field, adding depth to the team.

news.headline: Eventide Communications sees record growth in 2024, expands AI offerings to meet industry needs.
news.summary: In Little Ferry, New Jersey, on February 4, 2025, Eventide Communications, a prominent provider of essential recording solutions, is enhancing its product range to cater to changing industry demands. To support its growth plans, Eventide has introduced a new set of artificial intelligence tools.

news.headline: Merck's Gardasil vaccine slowdown in China impacts stock, sales reach $15.62B, EPS at $1.72.2025 outlook weak.
news.summary: Merck & Co Inc (NYSE: MRK) announced fourth-quarter sales totaling $15.62 billion, marking a 7% increase from the previous year and surpassing the estimated $15.49 billion. The sales saw a 9% rise excluding foreign exchange impacts. The adjusted earnings per share (EPS) stood at $1.72, a significant surge from $0.03 the previous year, and above the anticipated $1.62. The increase in EPS was primarily fueled by reduced charges for business developments and operational robustness. Merck's Chairman and CEO Robert Davis attributed the strong growth to the demand for their innovative product lineup, particularly KEYTRUDA, which is making a global impact in cancer patient treatment. The successful launch of WINREVAIR and the remarkable performance of the Animal Health division further contributed to the company's growth in 2024.

news.headline: Sun Country Airlines (NASDAQ:SNCY) Q4 earnings beat estimates by 35% with an EPS of ... (Released on Feb 4, 2025).
news.summary: Sun Country Airlines (NASDAQ:SNCY) unveiled its Q4 earnings report on February 4, 2025, at 06:00 AM. The report revealed that the company surpassed anticipated earnings by an impressive 35.0%, showcasing a notable earnings per share (EPS) of [specific value undisclosed]. news.summary: Mueller Industries (NYSE:MLI) released its Q4 earnings report on February 4, 2025, at 07:00 AM. The company exceeded estimated earnings by 8.0%, with an EPS of $1.21 compared to the estimate. Investors can find further details on Benzinga.com.

In this latest announcement, Mesa Laboratories surpassed expected earnings by a remarkable 80.0%, revealing an EPS of [number]. This substantial outperformance in earnings is crucial information for investors considering Mesa Laboratories stock. news.headline: Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) beats estimated Q2 earnings by 50%, reporting EPS of $0.96 versus estimate.
news.summary: On Tuesday, February 4, 2025, Fox (NASDAQ:FOXA) released its Q2 earnings at 08:00 AM. The earnings report revealed that Fox exceeded the estimated earnings by 50.0%, with an EPS of $0.96 compared to the projected amount. For more details, the full story is accessible on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: CTS reported Q4 earnings, missing estimates by -2.0% with an EPS of $0.53 (vs $0.54), revenue up $2.74 million from last year.
news.summary: CTS (NYSE:CTS) released its Q4 earnings on February 4, 2025, at 08:00 AM. The company reported an EPS of $0.53, which fell short of the estimated $0.54 by -2.0%. Revenue showed an increase of $2.74 million compared to the previous year's same period.

news.headline: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) beats Q4 earnings by 10%, reports EPS of $5.16. Detailed breakdown on Benzinga.com.
news.summary: On Tuesday, February 4, 2025, Cummins (NYSE:CMI) revealed its Q4 earnings at 07:30 AM. The report indicated that Cummins outperformed estimated earnings by 10.0%, posting an EPS of $5.16, surpassing the estimated figure of [specific number omitted]. For further details, the complete story can be accessed on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Lancaster Colony (LANC) reported Q2 earnings on Feb 4, 2025 at $1.78 EPS, missing estimates by -8.0%.
news.summary: Lancaster Colony (NASDAQ: LANC) released its second-quarter earnings report on Tuesday, February 4, 2025, at 07:30 AM. The company fell short of expected earnings by -8.0%, posting an EPS of $1.78. For further details, the complete article can be found on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Fox reported Q2 2025 revenues of $5.08B, net income $388M, and adjusted EBITDA $781M, driven by a 20% revenue increase.
news.summary: Fox Corporation reported a strong financial performance for the three months ended December 31, 2024. Total quarterly revenues reached $5.08 billion, up 20% from the previous year. Affiliate fee revenues grew by 6%, while advertising revenues surged by 21%, driven by political and sports advertising. Quarterly net income stood at $388 million, a significant jump from the $115 million of the prior year, with net income attributable to Fox Corporation stockholders at $373 million. Adjusted net income was $442 million. Adjusted EBITDA for the quarter was $781 million, an impressive 123% increase. The Cable Network Programming segment reported revenues of $2.17 billion, a 31% increase, and segment EBITDA of $657 million, up 16%. Television segment revenues were $2.96 billion, a rise of 16%, with EBITDA at $205 million. Fox Corporation's Executive Chair highlighted the strength of their live news and sports programming strategy and their commitment to shareholder value.

news.headline: Mesa Labs announces Q3 results: Revenue up 17.5%, operating income up 8,725% to $5,779, total revenues $62,840. CEO optimistic.
news.summary: Mesa Laboratories, Inc. announced its third fiscal quarter results for 2025, ending on December 31, 2024. Revenues increased by 17.5% compared to the previous year. The Non-GAAP core organic revenues increased by 13.2%. Operating income rose significantly by 8,725% to $5,779. The company operates in four divisions, with Sterilization and Disinfection Control being the largest at 37% of revenues. They also provided a breakdown of revenues by division, showing growth percentages. The company's CEO, Gary Owens, expressed positivity about overall growth, reduction in debt levels, and future strategies. Mesa Laboratories aims to reduce its Total Net Leverage Ratio below 3.0x by the end of the second quarter of 2026. The article also highlights the company's financial results, division performance, and the use of non-GAAP financial measures.

news.headline: PepsiCo Q4 saw revenue decline of 0.2% to $27.78B, missing estimates; Frito-Lay NA and Quaker Foods NA both dropped 2%.
news.summary: PepsiCo Inc (PEP) saw a decline in premarket trading after reporting lower-than-expected fourth-quarter revenue. The company's fourth-quarter sales dropped by 0.2% year-on-year to $27.78 billion, missing the analyst consensus of $27.89 billion. Net revenue from Frito-Lay North America and Quaker Foods North America both decreased by 2%, while PepsiCo Beverages North America remained steady. Sales in Latin America were down by 7% year-on-year, but Europe sales saw a 6% increase. The company's gross profit decreased by 1% year-on-year to $14.6 billion, with the margin contracting by 41 basis points to 52.6%.

news.headline: Alphabet stock may earn $500 monthly; Q4 earnings estimate is $2.13/share with $96.65 billion revenue projected.
news.summary: Alphabet Inc. is set to report its fourth-quarter financial results on Tuesday, February 4th after the markets close. Analysts predict earnings per share to be $2.13, a considerable increase from 69 cents in the same period last year. The tech giant is expected to reveal quarterly revenue of $96.65 billion, up sharply from $13.32 billion a year ago. Alphabet has continuously surpassed revenue expectations for the past seven quarters and exceeded earnings forecasts for seven quarters in a row. Investors are also looking at potential dividends, with Alphabet currently offering an annual dividend yield of 0.39%, totaling 20 cents per share quarterly, or 80 cents annually. The full article can be found on Benzinga.com.

news.headline: Exodus Movement offers to acquire Banxa Holdings, deemed "Superior Proposal" by Banxa Board, with deadline on Feb 10.
news.summary: Exodus Movement, Inc. has proposed to acquire all common shares of Banxa Holdings Inc., a financial technology platform, in a deal deemed a "Superior Proposal," according to Banxa's Board of Directors. The Board has given 1493819 B.C. Ltd. until February 10, 2025, to propose amendments that could potentially match or surpass the offer made by Exodus. This move indicates significant interest in the acquisition of Banxa, highlighting the growing importance of cryptocurrency platforms in the financial technology sector.

news.headline: Marathon Petroleum beats Q4 estimates with $33.47B revenues, $2.12B EBITDA, but sees decline in refining margins.
news.summary: Shares of Marathon Petroleum Corporation (NYSE:MPC) rose following the release of its fourth-quarter results. The company reported total revenues and other income of $33.47 billion, surpassing the consensus estimate of $31.12 billion. Adjusted EBITDA for the quarter was $2.12 billion, down from $3.57 billion in the previous year's quarter. Refining operating costs per barrel decreased to $5.26 from $5.55 year-over-year. Refining & Marketing refined product sales volume for the quarter was 3,747 mbpd, compared to 3,583 mbpd a year ago, while crude oil capacity utilization increased to 94% from 91% in the prior year quarter. The segment's adjusted EBITDA dropped to $559 million from $2.2 billion a year ago due to lower market crack spreads. The refining & Marketing margin was $12.93 per barrel for the fourth quarter, down from $17.81 per barrel in the same quarter of 2023.

news.headline: Supplemental Health Care wins 2025 Best of Staffing awards - retaining Diamond status, Best of Staffing Client and Talent.
news.summary: A press release from ClearlyRated on February 4, 2025, revealed that Supplemental Health Care (SHC) has been honored with the Best of Staffing Client and Best of Staffing Talent awards for delivering exceptional service. SHC has upheld its prestigious Diamond status, showcasing their commitment to excellence.

news.headline: 5G mobile backhaul transport market to grow at 12% CAGR, with peak spending expected in 2028 - Dell'Oro Group report.
news.summary: In 2028, it is projected that there will be a peak in spending for 5G mobile backhaul services. This information comes from a forecast report by Dell'Oro Group, a prominent provider of market insights in the telecommunications, security, networks, and data center sectors. The report suggests that significant investment will be made in this area, indicating a strong focus on advancing 5G technology. It is expected that substantial funds will be allocated towards enhancing mobile backhaul infrastructure to support the growing demands of 5G networks. This forecast highlights the increasing importance and emphasis on developing efficient backhaul solutions in the telecommunications industry.

news.headline: Palo Alto Networks (NASDAQ: PANW) to share Q2 2025 financial results on Feb 13 after U.S. markets close.
news.summary: In Santa Clara, California, on February 4, 2025, Palo Alto Networks, a global cybersecurity leader trading as NASDAQ: PANW, disclosed plans to unveil its financial results for the fiscal second quarter of 2025, concluding on January 31, 2025. The results will be released after the U.S. markets shut on Thursday, February 13.

news.headline: ePlus adds Juniper Mist to Managed Services, using AI for user experience. ePlus inc. (NASDAQ: PLUS) expands its portfolio.
news.summary: ePlus inc. (NASDAQ: PLUS) based in HERNDON, Va., revealed on Feb. 4, 2025, the introduction of a cloud-native solution that integrates AI and machine learning technologies. This innovation aims to enhance user experiences and streamline IT operations. The company has broadened its Managed Services range to include proactive services along with expanding capabilities in this domain.

news.headline: Power couple Kristina and Kirby Lavallee are building a dessert empire by mixing love and business successfully. TAMPA, Fla., Feb. 4, 2025 /PRNewswire - The Cake Girl.
news.summary: Kristina and Kirby Lavallee have found a winning formula by combining love and business, leading to their success. The couple from Tampa, Florida, are now set to reveal their recipe for achievements to a broader audience. On February 4, 2025, they disclosed their plans via PRNewswire to showcase the importance of love in their endeavors. As owners of The Cake Girl, their bakery business, they have experienced firsthand how incorporating love into their work has led to prosperity. Now, they are eager to inspire others with their story.

news.headline: Billiard TV plans to stream 150 days of live events in 2025, with 65 million viewers. Growth attributed to dedicated cue sports programming.
news.summary: The 24/7 billiards channel, Billiard TV, based in North Haven, Connecticut, experienced significant expansion in the last year. Specifically, the channel attracted an impressive 65 million viewers following its rapid growth. Billiard TV is known for being the first television network to offer round-the-clock programming focused solely on cue sports.

news.headline: OWC launches Dock Ejector 2.0 for safely ejecting connected devices, works with all docks.
news.summary: In Woodstock, Illinois, Other World Computing (OWC) has introduced the OWC Dock Ejector 2.0 for Mac and PC users. This new product is designed to efficiently and securely eject all connected devices, such as SoftRAID and AppleRAID volumes. The Dock Ejector 2.0 is now available for general purchase and is compatible with a variety of docks and hubs, even those not manufactured by OWC. This updated version aims to streamline the process of ejecting devices and enhancing the overall user experience.

news.headline: CyberArk and SentinelOne partner to enhance security with new integration, aimed at protecting against privileged access misuse.
news.summary: An alliance has been formed between CyberArk (NASDAQ: CYBR) and SentinelOne® (NYSE: S) to enhance protection against privileged access misuse. CyberArk, an identity security firm, recently unveiled a collaboration with SentinelOne's AI-powered cybersecurity platform, SentinelOne Singularity. This union integrates the strengths of both companies, combining the robust endpoint detection and response features of SentinelOne's Singularity™ Endpoint solution with CyberArk Endpoint Privilege Manager. This partnership aims to bolster defenses against security threats by leveraging the advanced technologies and expertise of the two industry leaders.

news.headline: VSee Health gets $340K contract to develop AI EHR system for major EAP provider, boosting efficiency.
news.summary: A technology company based in San Jose, California, VSee, has recently secured a contract worth $340,000 with a prominent Employee Assistance Program (EAP) provider. This contract is for the development of an Artificial Intelligence Electronic Health Record (AI EHR) system. The main objective behind this project is to enhance scalability and optimize operational efficiency within the organization.

news.headline: Inflectra partners with AWS ISV WMP to enhance cloud migration services. Stronger offering for clients.
news.summary: On February 4, 2025, Inflectra, a prominent provider of software lifecycle management solutions, revealed its participation in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Independent Software Vendor (ISV) Workload Migration Program (WMP). This strategic move signifies Inflectra's commitment to leveraging the cloud services of AWS for optimal business performance. Joining this program will enable Inflectra to streamline its operations, enhance scalability, and boost efficiency. This partnership is anticipated to bring about significant advantages to Inflectra's clients, allowing them to harness the power of AWS cloud services for seamless software management.

news.headline: Go Raw introduces new Snacking Granola featuring light, crispy clusters made from sprouted seeds and puffed grains. #OrganicSnacks #NewProduct #GoRaw
news.summary: A groundbreaking granola is revolutionizing snacking with its airy, crunchy clusters crafted from sprouted seeds and puffed grains. Recently launched by Go Raw, a leading brand in organic sprouted snacks, the Snacking Granola promises a delightful experience for snack enthusiasts. The product has been introduced in NORTHBROOK, Illinois on February 4, 2025, marking a significant milestone for the company. This innovative offering caters to those seeking a healthier snacking option and has been designed with larger clusters for enhanced satisfaction.

news.headline: Clearmind Medicine has patented a combination therapy for binge behavior treatment in Mexico using MEAI and N-Acylethanolamines.
news.summary: Clearmind Medicine Inc., a biotech company trading on Nasdaq under the symbol CMND and on FSE under the symbol CWY0, based in Vancouver, Canada, revealed on Feb. 4, 2025, that a patent has been published by the Instituto Mexicano de la Propriedad Industrial (IMPI), National Mexico Patent Office. The patent focuses on their unique combination therapy involving MEAI and N-Acylethanolamines aimed at addressing binge behavior issues like alcohol consumption, eating, tobacco use, shopping, and sexual conduct. This innovative therapy is part of Clearmind's efforts in developing psychedelic-derived therapeutics to tackle untreated health problems.

news.headline: LizzieSat™-3 has arrived at Vandenberg Space Force Base for launch with SpaceX in Q1 2025 as part of Transporter-13 mission.
news.summary: In Cape Canaveral, Florida, Sidus Space (NASDAQ: SIDU) has revealed that LizzieSat™-3 has reached Vandenberg Space Force Base in California for spacecraft integration. The satellite is anticipated to be launched into low Earth orbit in Q1 2025 as part of the Transporter-13 rideshare mission with SpaceX. The company stated that the satellite is prepared for liftoff, marking a significant step in its mission.

news.headline: rater8 announces winners of 2024 Practice Excellence Awards and introduces Certified GR8 Healthcare Organization Awards.
news.summary: In Montvale, New Jersey, on February 4, 2025, rater8, a prominent healthcare reputation management company, revealed the winners of its 2024 Practice Excellence Awards and launched the first-ever Certified GR8 Healthcare Organization Awards. These accolades recognize excellence in the healthcare industry and aim to promote outstanding healthcare practices.

news.headline: New study by Fastly & ESG shows cybersecurity challenges for professionals with insights from 383 in North America.
news.summary: In San Francisco, Fastly, Inc. (NYSE: FSLY), a top player in global edge cloud platforms, teamed up with Informa TechTarget’s Enterprise Strategy Group (ESG) to unveil a recent study. The study sheds light on the considerable hurdles faced by cybersecurity experts in addressing the swiftly changing application security environment. Titled "Balancing Requirements for Application Protection," the report draws from input provided by 383 cybersecurity and IT professionals in North America. It emphasizes the escalating challenges in the cybersecurity domain.

news.headline: Boxsy, an AI platform for startups, launches in Austin, Texas on Feb. 4, 2025. Helps eliminate operational burdens for founders, investors, and advisors.
news.summary: In Austin, Texas on February 4, 2025, Boxsy, an AI-powered operational platform catering to startups and their networks, is officially unveiled for public use. This launch aims to offer founders, investors, and advisors a comprehensive set of tools to streamline operations and prioritize expansion. Boasting a range of features tailored for this audience, Boxsy's focus is to assist in removing operational obstacles and drive growth among users.

news.headline: Alex Thurber from Riverbed in CA named on 2025 CRN Channel Chiefs list. Prestigious recognition.
news.summary: Alex Thurber, based in Redwood City, California, has been acknowledged on the esteemed 2025 CRN Channel Chiefs list.

news.headline: Job growth in U.S. small businesses on par with late 2024, with job growth rate below 100 and hourly earnings growth at 2.87%.
news.summary: In Rochester, NY, the Paychex Small Business Employment Watch reported that job growth in US small businesses with under 50 employees stayed just under 100 in January, in line with the previous six months of 2024. At the same time, hourly earnings growth for workers slowed to 2.87% in January, the first time falling below three percent at the start of the year since 2021. Small businesses showed resilience in adapting to economic shifts and labor market challenges.

news.headline: Amad Fida steps down as Brinqa CEO, Dan Pagel takes over to accelerate threat exposure management. Fida to continue as Chairman.
news.summary: In Austin, Texas, Amad Fida, the original CEO of Brinqa, has transitioned to the position of Chairman of the Board. This move ensures the ongoing commitment to the company's objectives, with Pagel stepping in as the new CEO to drive operations forward.

news.headline: Cardio Diagnostics partners with seven new provider organizations to expand AI-driven precision cardiovascular medicine tests.
news.summary: Cardio Diagnostics recently disclosed a strategic partnership with seven additional provider organizations in Chicago. This collaboration marks a significant milestone for the company as it expands its reach and impact in the healthcare sector.

news.headline: VSE Corporation to participate in TD Cowen 46th Annual Aerospace & Defense Conference in Arlington, VA on Feb 12th. CEO to present at 2:50 PM.
news.summary: In Miramar, Florida, VSE Corporation (NASDAQ: VSEC), a prominent aftermarket distribution and repair services provider, disclosed its participation in forthcoming conferences. VSE's senior management will be involved in the TD Cowen 46th Annual Aerospace & Defense Conference in Arlington, VA, on February 12th. At this event, John Cuomo, President and CEO of VSE Corporation, is scheduled to present at 2:50 PM Eastern Time. Additionally, management will engage in one-on-one meetings during the conference.

news.headline: CCC Repair Workflow now integrates with Tekion's cloud-native platform, providing link between shop management and dealer system.
news.summary: In Chicago, CCC Intelligent Solutions Inc. unveiled the integration of its CCC® Repair Workflow shop management solution with Tekion’s dealer management system (DMS) in their Automotive Retail Cloud (ARC) platform. This move connects essential systems for dealer and repair operations in the automotive industry. CCC is a prominent cloud platform provider for the P&C insurance sector. Tekion's DMS is a component of their cloud-native ARC platform, designed to serve the complete automotive retail landscape. This integration signifies a significant advancement, bringing together key solutions for streamlined operations.

news.headline: Orion S.A. (NYSE: OEC) signs supply deal with Contec S.A. for tire pyrolysis oil, diversifying sources for circular carbon black production.
news.summary: Orion S.A., a global specialty chemicals company listed on NYSE as OEC, revealed the signing of a lasting supply contract with Contec S.A. Orion will obtain tire pyrolysis oil from Contec, located in Warsaw, Poland, to create circular carbon black for their tire and rubber goods clients. This collaboration will allow Orion to expand its TPO sources. The agreement includes the use of ConPyro® TPO from Contec, enhancing Orion's capacity for significant production.
